data.title: David Lloyd George (1863-1945)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for David George born 1863 Chorlton-on-Medlock, Manchester, Lancashire, England, United Kingdom died 1945 Tŷ Newydd, Llanystumdwy, Caernarfonshire, Wales including ancestors + descendants + 2 photos + 5 genealogist comments + questions + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 20 Feb 2024 | Created 9 Sep 2014

This page has been accessed 5,884 times.

Preceded by

Herbert Henry Asquith

(1908-1916) 53rd Prime Minister of Great Britain

1916-1922 Succeeded by

Andrew Bonar Law

(1922-1923)

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Personal Life

1.2 Death

1.3 Censuses

2 Research Notes

3 Sources

Biography

David George is Notable.

Liberal, Welsh Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

Space Page: List of Prime Minister of England and United Kingdom. (https://www.wikitree.com/index.php?title=Space:List_of_Prime_Ministers_of_England_and_United_Kingdom.&public=1)

In the 1906 general election he stood against R. A. Naylor in Caernarfon , regarded as a safe Liberal seat, particularly against a ‘non Welsh speaking timber merchant and hymn writer’.See: Lloyd George: Statesman or Scoundrel. Richard Wilkinson Page43

Personal Life

David Lloyd George was born on 17 Jan 1863 at Chorlton-on-Medlock, Lancashire, Lancashire, England, United Kingdom and was baptised on 5 April 1863 in St Phillip, Salford, Lancashire, England. He was the son of of William David George, a Painter and Elizabeth Lloyd of 31 Hodson Street [1][2]

In the 1871 census David (age 7), Scholar, was the nephew of Richard Lloyd at Highgate, Llanystumdwy, Caernarfonshire, Wales.[3]

In the 1881 census David (age 18), Solicitors Articled Clerk, was the unmarried nephew of Richard Lloyd in Tanygrisiau Terrace, Criccieth, Caernarvonshire, Wales.[4]

David's marriage to Margaret Owen was registered in the Jan-Feb-Mar quarter of 1888 in the Pwllheli district.[5]

In the 1891 census David (age 28), Solicitor & M P, was the married head of household in Caernarfonshire, Wales.[6]

In the 1901 census David (age 38), Solicitor, was the married head of household at 179 Trinity Road, Wandsworth, Surrey, England.[7]

In the 1911 census David (age 48), Chancellor of Exchequer, was the married head of household at 11 Marie Place, Dover, Downing Street, Westminster, Middlesex, England.[8]

David was granted the Freedom of the City of London on 8th March 1917.[9]

His son. Richard Lloyd George married Roberta Freeman Macalpine on 9 April 1917 in Exeter, Devon, England.[10]

In the 1939 register David (age 76), Privcy Councillor,Member Of Parhament,Farmer, was recorded as married in Hambledon, Surrey, England.[11]

David's marriage to Frances Stevenson was registered in the Oct-Nov-Dec quarter of 1943 in the Surrey S.W. district.[12]

Death

David died on 26 March 1945 and was buried in Llanystumdwy, Gwynedd, Wales.[13]

His death (age 82) was registered in the Jan-Feb-Mar quarter of 1945 in the Pwllheli district.[14]

His estate passed probate on 31 July 1946 in Llandudno, Caernarfonshire, Wales.[15]

He was honoured with a memorial in Westminster Abbey. [16]

Obituary references

Daily Mail Hull, Yorkshire, England - 27 March 1945.[17]

Evansville Courier and Press - 27 March 1945 in Evansville, Vanderburgh, Indiana, United States.[18]

Manti Messenger, Utah, United States - 13 April 1945.[19]

Censuses

1871 Census - Highgate, Llanstumdwy, Caernarfonshire [3]

Richard Lloyd Head M 36 Shoemaker Llanystumdwy, Caernarvonshire

Elizabeth George Sister Widowed Formerly School Master's wife F 42 Wife Llanystumdwy, Caernarvonshire

Mary Ellen George Niece F 9 Scholar Newchurch, Lancashire

David Lloyd George Nephew M 7 Scholar Manchester, Lancashire

William George Nephew M 5 Scholar Llanystumdwy, Caernarvonshire

1881 Census - 3 Tanygrisiau Terrace, Criccieth, Caernarfonshire [4]

Richard Lloyd Head Unmarried M 46 Pastor Of A Christian Church Criccieth, Caernarvonshire

Elizabeth Lloyd George Sister Widowed F 52 Formerly Farmers Wife Criccieth, Caernarvonshire

Mary Ellen George Niece Unmarried F 19 Formerly Farmers Daughter Newchurch, Lancashire, England

David Ll George Nephew Unmarried M 18 Solicitors Articled Clerk Manchester, Lancashire, England

William George Nephew Unmarried M 16 Scholar Llanystumdwy, Caernarvonshire

1891 Census - Criccieth[6]

David Lloyd George Head Married M 28 Solicitor & M P England

Margaret Lloyd George Wife Married F 26 Carnarvonshire

Richard Lloyd George Son M 2 Carnarvonshire

Maira Eiluned Lloyd George Daughter F 0 Carnarvonshire

1901 Census - 179 Trinity Road, Wandsworth Surrey[7]

David L George Head Married M 38 Solicitor Manchester

Margaret L George Wife Married F 36 Criccieth, Carnarvonshire

Richard L George Son Single M 12 Criccieth, Carnarvonshire

1911 Census - 11 Marie Place, Dover, Downing Street, Westminster, Middlesex [8]

David Lloyd George Head Married M 48 Chancellor of Exchequer Manchester, Lancashire

Margaret Lloyd George Wife Married F 46 Criccieth, Carnarvonshire

Richard Lloyd George Son Single M 22 Civil Engineer Criccieth, Carnarvonshire

Megan Lloyd George Daughter F 8 Criccieth, Carnarvonshire

John Rowland Private secretary Married M 33 Private Secretary To Chancellor of Exchange Tregarm, Cardiganshire

Sarah Jones Servant Single F 39 Housemaid Criccieth, Carnarvonshire

Annie Evans Servant Single F 25 Parlourmaid Llanystymdwy, Carnarvonshire

Lizzie Jane Jones Servant Single F 16 Kitchenmaid Fourcrosses, Carnarvonshire

1939 Register - Bron-y-de, Hambledon, Surrey[11]

David Lloyd George Married M 17 Jan 1863 Privcy Councillor, Member Of Parliament, Farmer

George Frances L Lloyd (Stevenson) Single F 7 Oct 1888 Private Secretary

Reginald B Bartling Married M 25 Apr 1902 Messenger & Clerk Private House

Linda Smith Single F 19 Aug 1908 Maid

Closed Record

Violet E Hutchings Married F 31 Jan 1919

Research Notes

David was in an obituary of Lord Richard Burdon Haldane on 20 August 1928 in Tampa, Florida.[20]
